page.title: 07EVENTS IN SHELDON
page.content: MANY EVENTS ARE CELEBRATED IN CHURCH FROM THE CHURCH CALENDAR e.g.MOTHERING SUNDAY,HARVEST FESTIVAL.OTHER SOCIAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDING FAYRES,COFFEE MORNINGS etc.TAKE PLACE IN THE TINY VILLAGE HALL.'SHELDON DAY'WAS OUR BIGGEST EVENT EVER,LAST JULY WHEN OUR TINY VILLAGE RAISED Â£1,500 TO HELP RENOVATE OUR VILLAGE HALL.THIS JULY WE AGAIN HAD A SHELDON FELL RACE AND A CLAY PIGEON SHOOT AS PART OF THE DAY+STALLS AND GAMES,CREAM TEAS,THE BAND AND 'VILLAGE PUB'.A SHEEP ROAST AND STREET DANCING TO MUSIC WAS HELD IN THE EVENING.SHELDON DAY ATTRACTS TOURISTS AND LOCAL PEOPLE.THE LOCAL HUNT (FOR HARES)STARTS FROM SHELDON ONCE EVERY WINTER.WAKES WEEK USED TO BE HELD IN OCTOBER BUT HAS LONG SINCE BEEN DISCONTINUED.THERE IS NO HISTORY OF WELLS DRESSING BUT IT IS HOPED TO START THIS AS A TOURIST ATTRACTION
